original: In the haplontic life cycle, an organism concludes its diploid phase by producing several haploid cells. These haploid cells can undergo mitotic division, resulting in either larger multicellular individuals or additional haploid cells. The fusion of two distinct types of gametes, such as male and female gametes, leads to the formation of a zygote. Throughout this life cycle, the zygote is the sole diploid cell, while mitosis occurs exc
